LEAD: The Soviet physicist YURI F. ORLOV disclosed a letter-writing campaign endorsed by hundreds of scientists to secure the release of FANG LIZHI, the Chinese astrophysicist who took refuge in the United States after last June's crackdown in Beijing.

The Soviet physicist YURI F. ORLOV disclosed a letter-writing campaign endorsed by hundreds of scientists to secure the release of FANG LIZHI, the Chinese astrophysicist who took refuge in the United States after last June's crackdown in Beijing.

Three Nobel laureates in physics, DONALD A. GLASET, OWEN CHAMBERLAIN and HANS A. BETHE, as well as other prominent scientists, have pledged not to take part in scientific conferences in China until Dr. Fang and his family are allowed safe passage out of the country.

Dr. Orlov, who in 1986 was released from nine years of Soviet labor camp and Siberian exile, will present the campaign at the National Press Club in Washington this morning. ''Until these demands are met, it is crucial that the Government in Beijing, and our counterparts in the Chinese Academy of Sciences, realize that China will pay a heavy price for its treatment of Dr. Fang,'' Dr. Orlov wrote in a letter to the other scientists.
